alert.note: Alert for Morris; Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 3:16PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Morris, central Sussex and northeastern Warren Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 316 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hope, or 14 miles southwest of Newton, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, Dover, Hopatcong, Kinnelon, Hackettstown, Butler, Wharton, Blairstown, Mount Arlington, Franklin, Stanhope, Riverdale, Hamburg, Netcong, Oxford, Ogdensburg, Sussex, Hope, Branchville and Andover. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 6 and 36. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 52 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
